name: Project Management Tool - Full JTBD Analysis
description: Complete Jobs to Be Done analysis for a project management tool targeting distributed teams

inputs.context: B2B SaaS project management tool designed for distributed teams working across time zones. Current market dominated by feature-heavy tools that require extensive training. Target customers are growing startups (10-100 employees) struggling with coordination overhead.
inputs.researchData: Conducted 25 customer interviews with project managers and team leads. Key findings: 1) Average team spends 8+ hours per week in status meetings, 2) 60% report information scattered across email, Slack, and spreadsheets, 3) Biggest struggle is maintaining alignment without constant meetings, 4) Most tried 3+ tools before finding current solution, 5) Primary switching trigger: New remote team members unable to get up to speed quickly.

mainJobs: Keep distributed team aligned on project progress without constant meetings
Quickly communicate blockers to stakeholders before they cascade
Onboard new team members to project context without hand-holding

keyForces.strongestPush: Too many meetings eating up productive time
keyForces.strongestPull: Single source of truth for all project information

jobStories: When project deadlines are approaching, I want to see all blockers across teams at a glance, so I can quickly intervene before delays cascade
When team members are in different time zones, I want to communicate updates asynchronously, so I can maintain momentum without scheduling meetings
When new team members join, I want them to understand project context quickly, so I don't spend hours explaining everything
mustHaveFeatures: Visual project timeline with blockers highlighted
Self-service project context for new members
